svg.content: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2022-01-06T23:13:04.993Z" agent="5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/96.0.4664.45 Safari/537.36" etag="GN_g1MS602bw2SRHOYLF" version="15.5.8" type="device"><diagram id="C5RBs43oDa-KdzZeNtuy" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 368px; height: 1px; padding-top: 80px; margin-left: 271px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 448px; height: 1px; padding-top: 230px; margin-left: 231px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.p:
Are any of the following present?
1) Altered Level of Consciousness
2) Cyanosis/Exhaustion
3) Use of accessory muscles
4) Silent Chest
5) Too breathless to talk
6) Unable to lie supine
7) Pulsus Paradoxus (severe >10mmHg children, >18mmHg Teenagers

switch.text: Are any of the following present?...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 348px; height: 1px; padding-top: 390px; margin-left: 281px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 340px; margin-left: 430px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 568px; height: 1px; padding-top: 560px; margin-left: 171px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Initial Management
1) Humidified Oxygen, aim sats >95%
2) ECG monitoring, inform senior staff
3) Nebulised salbutamol, every 20mins for 1st hour
2.5mg<4 years, 2.5-5mg >5 years
4) Ipratropium Bromide
250microgram every 20 mins for 1st hour
5) Steroid
Hydrocortisone IV 4mg/kg (max 100mg) or Prednisolone PO 2mg/kg (max 60mg)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 598px; height: 1px; padding-top: 845px; margin-left: 156px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Doctor to Reassess and consider Alternatives, Nursing staff to prepare 2nd line medications
Magnesium Sulphate IV + IV Salbutamol and/or IV Aminophylline
Magnesium Sulphate: 40mg/kg (max 2g, dilute to 2g/20ml 0.9% NaCl) over 20minutes (10 minutes in life threatening asthma)
Salbutamol: Loading dose at 5mcg/kg/min for 1 hour (1.5ml/kg/hr of 200microgram/ml solution)
Aminophylline: 500mg to a total volume of 500ml 0.9% NaCl. Loading dose 5mg/kg over 20mins (max dose 500mg. If weight >66kg loading dose over 30mins)
NIV may be used
Alternative Diagnoses:
Anaphylaxis
Pneumothorax
Collapsed Lung
Inadequate Drug Delivery

switch.text: Doctor to Reassess and consider Alternatives, Nursing staff to prepare 2nd line medica...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 588px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1150px; margin-left: 161px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Intubation
Indications: Sats<92% despite high flow, Hypercarbia CO2 >6kPa, Fatigue,
Apnoeas, Severe Dyspnoea, Reduced GCS, Poor air entry/absent wheeze
How: Senior anaesthetist, Pre-oxygenate, 2xlarge bore IV cannula, Suction ready
Preload with Plasmalyte 10-20ml/kg
Adrenaline: 0.1ml/kg of 1:10'000,
( made up to 10ml with 0.9% NaCl. 1ml = 1mcg/kg)
Ketamine: 1-2mg/kg
Fentanyl: 1mcg/kg
Rocuronium: 1mg/kg

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 272px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 5px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left; max-height: 70px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 16px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
